417886

Company

Siemens Medical Solutions USA, Inc.

Organization

Siemens Healthineers

Job Family

Marketing

Experience Level

Experienced Professional

Full Time / Part Time

Full-time

Remote vs Office

Remote Only

Contract Type

Permanent

Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

Who we are:
We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as a Product Marketing Leader, Angiography: Cardiovascular Care, North America

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Product Marketing Leader , you will oversee the marketing efforts in the Interventional Radiology market segment :

  • You help assess and create IR segment marketing plan and strategy
  • You will plan, coordinate, and direct IR segment marketing efforts
  • You will conduct competitive research and segment demand for products and services required in the IR space
  • You will develop promotions, marketing collateral, and track marketing efforts
  • You will support the field sales teams with the tools they require to engage with customers and develop the business

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to develop your career with Healthineers

  • Developing and executing a robust portfolio marketing strategy
  • Owning the marketing customer journey: from awareness to customer advocacy
  • Driving the use of customer, market and competitive research to understanding customer's clinical, operational, and economic needs, as well as values and benefits sought to identify market opportunities for the cardiovascular portfolio
  • Creating go-to-market strategies, market messages with clearly defined differentiators, and content
  • Manage customer-focused events (tradeshows, webinars, live-cases, customer gathering events)
  • Creating diverse marketing collateral like case studies, data sheets, whitepapers, evidence/outcomes, briefs, FAQs, blog posts, ROI tools, new media, and much more.

Required skills to have for the success of this role

  • Minimum of 10+ years of experience in clinical marketing, product management or related experience with a preference towards experience with capital imaging devices.
  • Strong knowledge of the medical industry and understanding of the regulations by which marketing must abide.
  • Bachelor degree required, marketing focus preferred

Job Description:

401857

Organization

Siemens Healthineers

Experienced Professional

Full-time

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world?

At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

Our global team : We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture : We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers .

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone to grow personally and professionally.

Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as a Customer Success Manager.

· Service Area – Baltimore, MD & Washington D.C. Area

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Customer Success Manager, you will be responsible for the following :


Customer Success Manager Role Overview & Responsibilities:

  • This is an on-site position requiring a physical presence at the main customer site as well as regular visits to satellite campuses (hospitals and imaging centers)
  • Establishes and maintains close working relationships with the customer, local Regional Service Manager (RSM), Key Account Manager (KAM)/Key Account Executive (KAE) (Sales teams), Customer Service Engineers (CSEs), and other support resources
  • Understands the organizational structure of customer’s business, along with that of the Siemens service and sales support teams
  • Is the “Voice of the Customer”
  • Acts as the main point of contact for all customer communication and interaction with internal sales, support, and service organizations
  • Supports all aspects of service delivery and daily operations

General Responsibilities:

  • Business Management: Works with Local Regional Service Manager (RSM) to plan and manage the service business as contracted through Siemens
  • Customer Satisfaction: Works with local RSM(s) to help ensure customers receive optimum levels of service and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction with Siemens
  • Administrative/Other Tasks: Performs administrative and other tasks required of the position that support Siemens, service, and the customer
  • Meet all Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) of the business for the assigned responsibilities
  • Monitor training for personnel resources and provide feedback to RSM(s) to ensure only trained personnel are servicing equipment
  • Tasks and Support Activities of the CSM (Service Support)

Daily Operational Activities & Responsibilities:

  • Immediate availability to oversee all operational activities (acts as on-site RSM)
  • Regular physical visits to all main sites as contractually obligated and required by the customer
  • Receives system status alerts and provides regular communications to key customer contacts on all service activity, with a specific focus on EC1 (down system) and EC2 (restricted operation) calls
  • Actively uses information in the Customer Distress Index (CDI) dashboard to identify specific Functional Locations (FLs) which are causing customer distress. Partners closely with the Regions RSM team, while keeping KAE/KAM (Sales partners) updated
  • Analyzes and interprets Accounts Receivable (AR) status and provides guidance and recommendations to internal partners
  • Communicates information between customer and Siemens stakeholders (Sales & Service)
  • Maintains customer contact lists by department and campus to ensure critical stakeholders are identified and receive proper communication from Siemens
  • Engages in technical escalation management by supporting the process with the RSM, CSE, Customer Service Material Logistics (CSML) (parts) and technical support resources. Communication to the customer is an essential part of this activity. In addition, provides the sales team with regular updates
  • Analyzes Preventive Maintenance (PM) and Update Instruction (UI) activity for all FLs at the assigned customer sites and communicates directly with Customer Call Center (CCC) and CSE resources to deliver 100% compliance
  • Acts as liaison between Siemens service team and customer in-house service (Biomed/Clinical Engineering) where applicable
  • Conducts billing validation, oversees the Purchase Order (PO) process (to include creation and approval request for vendor services) and performs any other service-based administrative activity
  • Manages escalations between internal and external service providers
  • Weekly Operational Activities and Responsibilities:
  • Reviews PM and UI schedule and completion activity with the CCC and local resources
  • Inventory control by identifying and verifying equipment (FL) locations
  • Supports Project Management activities and Installation activities (through participation in regular conference calls)
  • Conducts physical visits to all main sites
  • Works with Lifecycle Analyst (LCA) to help qualify inventory and billing
  • Audits invoices and works with AR credit and collection for both contract and Time and Material (T&M) billing. Collaborates with RSM(s) and KAM/KAE
  • Track/manage any onsite inventory (repair parts classified as depot level storage)
  • Supports local service team through interaction and engagement with support vendors (i.e., KKT, Messer, etc.)

Monthly/Quarterly Operational Activities and Responsibilities:

  • Schedules face-to-face meetings with appropriate customer representatives
  • Collaborates with RSM(s) and KAM/KAE to collect data and provide insightful Quarterly Business Review (QBR) documentation, helping customers understand their operations
  • Schedules and conducts Quarterly Business Review (QBR)
  • Identifies End of Service (EOS) systems and communicates with sales team and customer to avoid customer dissatisfaction
  • Tracks and reports Clinical Education and Technical Training balances
  • Participates in local service/CSE quarterly meetings

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

  • BS/BA in a medical field, engineering/technology or business administration with healthcare background preferred
  • Minimum of 3 years professional experience with a background in supporting imaging technology maintenance operations excellence
  • Acts as advisor to customer management and business partners on asset management matters
  • Excellent communication skills – verbal, written, presentation
  • Must be results-driven, action oriented and passionate about making a positive customer impact while balancing business needs

At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Commercial Pricing Specialist.

SHS Enterprise Services offers long term partnership agreements with customers allowing us to implement long term (5, 7, 10+ years) strategic and operational goals through the entire Siemens Healthineers portfolio which can include Imaging Equipment and Services, Diagnostics, Education and Workforce, Digital Solutions, Consulting, etc., for both Siemens and Multi-Vendor install base.

This role will be a finance business partner to the sales team to develop exclusive finance solutions and pricing strategies along with risk adverse reviews to initiate contract negotiations.

Your Role:

  • Developing finance solutions and pricing strategy prior to the bid phase for our Value Partnerships.
  • Considering financials, deal structuring, business forecasting, risk review to assist with bid proposals.
  • Using financial modeling and commercial risk management in analysis.
  • Drive digitalization and business model initiatives.
  • Review deals with non-standard terms to ensure viability of discounts & gross margins.
  • Leading protection of company assets, application of control procedures, and financial planning and reporting within stated guidelines and policies.
  • Providing recommendations based on advanced root cause and alternative solution analysis.
  • Develop and present TCO models across, service and equipment for the entire Healthineers portfolio.
  • Growing sales and financing programs for customer segments including financial analysis/deal modeling and deal strategy/structure.
  • Owning commercial/contract activities, pricing, margin calculations.

Your Expertise:

  • Engaging in a customer facing role with C-Suite Customers and SHS Senior executives and stakeholders.
  • Striving to drive profitable growth and customer retention through the development of pricing, deal structuring, performance share solutions for the largest IDN accounts and Group Purchasing Organizations (GPO’s).
  • Understanding and staying abreast of current Value Partnerships and Multi-Vendor Medical Imaging market conditions and the competitive landscape.
  • Most contracts/bids require an understanding of the entire Healthcare business including all associated pricing models. Individual IDN deals, which are being negotiated with financial, customer facing support from this position, carry an average of $5M to $30M in annual revenue, which agreements under this position can determine revenues of up to $50M to $500M in a single negotiation.
  • Collaborating with sales to assist with development strategic account planning across all Business Areas of Healthineers. Strategic planning and development of proposals and the interplay between GPO, IDN, and IDN subnetworks is a key element in the scope of this role.

Required Skills, Education and Experience for this position:

  • BS/BA in related discipline or an advanced degree may be substituted for experience.
  • 8-10+ years of successful experience in related field and successful demonstration of responsibilities as presented above.
  • Demonstrated extensive knowledge in field of specialization or multiple disciplines to the successful completion of complex assignments preferred.
  • Demonstrated comprehensive knowledge of organization's business practices and issues faced and contributes to problem resolution of those issues preferred.
  • Experience in Long Term Value Partnerships and/or Multi-Vendor market would be a plus.
  • Ability to understand and communicate complex financial concepts including rate of return, depreciation, working capital, investments, and financial and expense performance comparisons. Conforms to accounting guidelines.

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. At Siemens Healthineers, We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as Project Manager – Medical Imaging Equipment Installations in the Portland/Eugene Oregon area. This role reports to the Zone VP of Project Management and Operations.


Our global team : We are a team of more than 70,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.


Our culture : We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers .

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Project Manager – Medical Imaging Equipment Installations, y ou will be responsible to :

  • Manage multiple projects in support of ground-up new hospital or research facilities.
  • Develop and implement detailed solutions for complex project challenges by working with advanced stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Support RFP process for installation related topics.
  • Attend presale meetings with AEs and support the sales relationship with customers as required.
  • Visit project sites to secure measurements, produce cost estimates, review quotes and key project success factors such as electrical and construction requirements with customers.
  • Consult with customers to optimize equipment layouts and clinical workflow to incorporate into drawings and project plans
  • Communicate customer specifications to planners to develop preliminary and final drawings site specific CAD drawings.
  • Communicate project information, status updates, schedule and scope changes to internal and external stakeholders; i.e customer, customer’s architect, engineer, contractor, administration, Siemens Sales and Service partners, etc.
  • Assist in development, coordination, and finalization of project schedules for system production, delivery, installation and applications.
  • Regularly Communicate project schedule, risks and other pertinent issues to internal and external stakeholders
  • Perform regular site visits and monitor progress of site preparation to ensure that all tasks are being completed on schedule in order to meet assigned project completion dates that impact Siemens profitability.
  • Maintain accurate and appropriate data in the appropriate data systems and Project Management tools
  • Coordinate and adjust schedules as necessary to minimize unexpected cost increases, to maintain costs, and/or to improve overall profitability to Siemens—while maintaining customer satisfaction
  • Handle and respond to customer questions, complaints, and problems to maintain high levels of customer satisfaction throughout the project
  • Complete mandatory Siemen’s forms/checklists required at specific project milestones
  • Conduct/assist in training of other Project Managers, participate in Advisory Boards, task force activities, special projects, etc.
  • Follow Siemens and customer policies such as safety, regulatory, dress codes/appearance and business conduct
  • Follow all Siemens quality control protocols and escalation policies in project communications
  • Maintain optimum communication practices—respond to daily telephone, email, and written messages in a timely manner
  • Manage travel and office expenses to control costs. Maintain Siemens assets (telephones, cars, tools, etc) to ensure longevity and avoid breakdowns

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers

  • Overseeing logistics, planning, delivery and installation activities for imaging equipment across all modalities (i.e. MR, CT, X-Ray) within Siemens Healthineers [Planning for Radiographic, Fluoroscopy, Cardiology, Angiography, Computerized Tomography, Magnetic Resonance, Therapy, Nuclear Medicine and PET Systems]
  • Fostering and maintaining high level relationships in key accounts, and for driving revenue by working with customer stakeholders to develop project pre-construction plans, estimates, and schedules.
  • Monitoring construction progress, coordinating with stakeholders (facilities, architects, mechanical, electrical and structural engineers, etc.), solving and coordinating construction issues and managing delivery and installation activities according to a schedule established mutually with the customer.
  • Maintaining s full project involvement until completion of all Siemens activities including Applications and follow up Service.  Serves as primary point of contact for problem resolution for full duration of the project.

Required skills to have for the success of this role

  • Bachelor’s degree or combination of education and experience
  • A minimum of 2-4 years of complex project management experience; managing multiple projects simultaneously specific to construction in healthcare environments
  • Experience in dealing with executive-level management and clinicians within a diverse customer organization
  • Must have ability to read blueprint drawings
  • Extensive experience at successfully managing matrix project teams, third party vendors and working within a large corporate structure
  • Knowledge of the construction industry (electrical, plumbing, structural, HVAC
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong working knowledge of the construction industry.
  • Well-organized problem solver with the ability to work autonomously in a field-based position with little direct oversight
  • CAD knowledge preferred
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills preferred
  • Familiarity with Siemens capital medical imaging equipment preferred
  • Previously or currently licensed tradesman desirable
  • PMP Certification desirable
  • Ability to Attain/Maintain PMP credential as required for position advancement desired
  • Ability to travel up to 75%
  • Candidates must reside in the Portland or Eugene Oregon area


Field-based and offers company car, also for private use

The Marketing Communications Specialist is supporting all DI Business Lines. The individual will focus on developing and executing campaigns and other marketing projects. This individual works closely with the NAM MarCom Managers and NAM Business Line teams, and peers aligned to all business areas and business lines.

The idea candidate is passionate about developing, digital and data-driven customer journeys accompanied by multi-channels campaigns. It is a mission that takes strong project management skills, creativity, storytelling, passion, and teamwork to be the best.

The individual contributor, reports to Head of Marketing Communications, U.S..

Responsibilities:
  • Be a partner to the Marketing Communications Managers. Collaborate with business line to execute on Marketing plans and strategic priorities
  • Develop, execute on agreed upon timelines and continuously optimize integrated digital, multichannel campaigns based on data to increase customer engagement and provide Marketing Qualified Leads
  • Create customer-centric and searchable messaging based on value-based and regulatory approved content provided by Marketing Manager and translate into channel and audience-specific messaging
  • Develop, execute, and continuously optimize media strategy/plans based on analytics
  • Develop intuitive sales enablement assets in collaboration with Marketing Manager, monitor effectiveness and increase usage through ONE Library
  • Manage agency landscape and all related projects with external and internal agencies and groups (i.e., PR, social media)
  • Share campaign and vehicle metrics as well as industry trends including recommendations with key stakeholders on a regular basis
  • Ensure brand consistency both internally and externally
Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Marketing, Communications, or related field
  • 6+ years of relevant experience in B2B marketing
  • Experience in healthcare marketing communications field
  • Operational and business acumen
  • Proven results in cross-functional collaboration
  • Proven ability to develop customer-centric Marketing Communication programs including digital, multichannel campaigns and value-based messaging
  • Proven ability to evaluate the performance and impact of a channels/campaigns to continuously improve the contribution to the bottom line
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment, while meeting all deadlines.
  • Sophisticated relationship skills to ensure positive interfacing with all levels of colleagues and effectively work across all organizational stakeholders
  • Strategic thinker with high attention to detail
  • Excellent communications skills including copywriting
  • Collaborates effectively to deliver results in a timely manner
  • Ability to work well in highly matrixed, global organization

Experienced Professional

Full-time

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Point of Care Zone Head, Customer Experience Specialists to lead and manage the zone Customer Experience Specialist (CES) team, driving excellence in all aspects of customer interactions with Siemens Healthineers Point of Care (SHS POC).

Your role:

  • Utilize your strong clinical background to coordinate sales cycle activities with an emphasis on implementation and day-to-day customer support, putting the customer first
  • Leading the team to execute both short- and longer-term customer support and loyalty strategies that result in financial goal attainment, strong customer partnership, as well as team growth and development
  • Working with their partner Account Executive (AE) zone head to identify and synthesize customer and competitor insights, market trends and influences, together with industry challenges, and apply SHS POC product solutions to drive long-term sales success, while fostering enduring customer relationships
  • Managing and leading change in a positive manner while developing a culture of accountability and customer excellence
  • Champion new initiatives and identify opportunities to build a culture of collaboration within the zone, together with their partner AE team
  • Drive processes and strategies that coordinate sales cycle activities, with an emphasis on excellence in implementation and day-to-day customer support. Ensuring that the customer is the priority and owning successful product / solutions implementations at account sites
  • Collaborate with other internal teams to deliver the optimal customer experience throughout the sales and customer lifecycle. This includes but is not limited to Marketing, Sales Operations, Finance, Service, Business Excellence, PMO and Logistics
  • Management of customer support activities, tracking of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and identification of areas for improvement within the customer journey
  • Ensure that all detailed sales forecasting, training modules, and required reporting, including in all required internal quality and other tools and processes, are completed promptly and accurately by all team members
  • Budget responsibility for travel and expenses for zone CES team including the responsibility to oversee and manage spending in line with the company’s goals and expectations

Your expertise:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a biological science, nursing, or respiratory therapy
  • Minimum of 8 years of increasing responsibility & experience as a medical technologist, point of care coordinator, respiratory therapist, or nurse. Point of care experience preferred – end user or oversight
  • 3+ years of experience in medical device product areas or related disciplines
  • Strong people management skills with previous team leadership experience and demonstrated success in that role
  • Experience in lean six-sigma and/or complex project management within a hospital or laboratory setting
  • Must possess outstanding oral, written and presentation communication skills that can be applied to customers, direct reports and SHS management
  • Ability to demonstrate critical thinking and decision making
  • Highly organized, able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
  • Possesses strong MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word) skills
  • Experience in the use of customer relationship management (CRM) platforms is required
  • Established contacts at Hospital Systems and/or Integrated Delivery networks (IDNs) within assigned zone preferred
  • Must reside and be able to travel within the assigned zone and other business locations in the USA as required

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at : https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/point-of-care-testing

Who we are:
We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

How we work:
When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site https://jobs.siemens-healthineers.com/careers

The pay range for this position is $128,000-$168,000 annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The annual incentive target is $70,000. Siemens Healthineers offers a variety of health and wellness benefits including paid time off and holiday pay. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://benefitsatshs.com/index.html

This information is provided per the required states Pay Transparency Laws. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Siemens Healthineers external or internal careers site.

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. Please create a profile within our talent community and subscribe to personalized job alert that will keep you posted about new opportunities.

Apply now for the position of Account Executive, Point of Care and manage your territory offering Siemen’s Diagnostic Point of Care (POC) products, services, and solutions to new or existing hospital or hospital owned/operated customers directly and through channel partners.

Your role:

  • You are responsible for the direct and indirect sale of our POC product, which includes Blood Gas, EPOC, IT Solutions
  • You are responsible for high volume hospital segments and prospecting for new business while managing and maintaining established customer accounts
  • Will achieve sales goals through direct and distribution channels
  • You develop the territory sales strategy for penetrating the hospital POC market through direct and distribution channels
  • You develop growth forecasts and funnels for POC product portfolio and/or distribution channels to ensure the highest level of service to achieve overall goals
  • Execute upon Sales and Marketing Strategic Imperatives established by Sr. Sales and Marketing leadership.

Your expertise:

  • Proven history of successful capital sales achievement with a minimum of five years of direct and/or channel partnership experience.
  • Ability to influence distribution partners and collaborate across all levels of an organization (internal and external).
  • Familiar with Miller Heiman or SPIN sales processes and methodology
  • Proven experience selling across multiple departments complex direct and indirect capital sale within the hospital market.
  • High level of presentation skills and ability to motivate and inspire others to exceed their goals.
  • Reside in assigned territory with ability to travel.
  • Experience selling Point-of-Care clinical products or clinical lab diagnostic products strong preference.

Apply now for the position of Delivery Team Order Manager and you will support the Order Management team within the Customer Supply Chain area.


Your role:

  • You have good PC skills (MS Office software like Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook)

Apply now for the position of Point of Care Customer Experience Specialist, (CES) to p rovide support along every phase of the customer journey for all key accounts within their designated territory.

Your role:

  • Assist in the assessment of new opportunities and crafting key account plans alongside your partner Account Executive (AE)
  • Deliver reagent, instrument and informatics volume utilization as directed by key account plans and POC performance targets
  • Increase and maintain customer loyalty that delivers continual product retention and customer feedback scores at or ahead of promoted classification
  • Complete pre-sales activities and assess current workflows and evaluate the needs and goals of the customer – including support, training and implementation
  • Act in project management capacity with customers for implementations, go-live installations and support of informatics / middleware connectivity with POC devices
  • Identify customer needs and requirements, including pre and post analytical reviews, in support of the successful adoption of POC technology by end users in key accounts
  • Perform all EPOC installation and implementation requirements in customer sites as appropriate
  • Subject matter expert for all SHS and competitive emergency, critical and primary care product lines (and competitors) both technically & clinically. Strong functional understanding of POC Informatics and customer information interfaces
  • Assist the partner AE throughout the sales cycle to assess and position the optimal workflow and effectiveness solutions to meet the needs of the customer
  • Develop and coordinate the customer training, implementation, and go-live plan in conjunction with customer service to ensure that the account meets or exceeds implementation timelines and end-user proficiency over product usage lifecycles
  • Work with customers to establish training and verification/validation requirements and conduct troubleshooting activities
  • Develop adoption strategies that focus on best practice change management and monitor the onboarding of customers (stakeholder engagement, change management, implementation plans) towards to increase the use of our Point of Care (POC) products
  • Assist the customer in establishing & maintaining standardizations, standing orders and best practices post go-lives
  • In partnership with the AE, perform regular business reviews at required intervals including the assessment of error rates, reagent and consumable ordering, service contract management, customer satisfaction, potential unmet needs, improvement ideas, etc. with a view to further develop the partnership with the account
  • In partnership with the AE, work to review and target customers with a legacy install base, to determine to optimal solutions for the customer and the company
  • Work with key accounts and stakeholders to establish laboratory requirements (eg., CLIA, CAP, JCAHO)
  • Liaise between sales, technical, service and PMO organizations to drive a positive and seamless customer experience
  • Communicate product update and improvement information to customers in accordance with regulatory, quality and compliance guidelines
  • Demonstrate and/or socialize all of Siemens Healthineers products and services to develop the customer partnership further and foster customer loyalty
  • Document all customer activities in the appropriate customer relationship management (CRM), Quality Management System (QMS) and/or other tools and processes in a timely and compliant manner as required
  • Ensure that all detailed sales forecasting, training modules, and required reporting, including in all required internal quality and other tools and processes, are completed promptly and accurately
  • Attend and present at local, regional, and national conferences as subject matter experts
  • Work with internal teams such as Marketing to develop and maintain relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs)

Your expertise:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a biological science, nursing, or respiratory therapy
  • 4+ years of work history as a medical technologist, point of care coordinator, respiratory therapist, or nurse
  • Point of care testing experience, either end user or oversight is preferred
  • Experience in lean six-sigma and/or complex project management within a hospital or laboratory setting
  • Outstanding oral, written and presentation communication skills that can be applied to customers, with the ability to present technical information in a clear and concise manner to drive sales success
  • Highly proficient in the use of sales and customer relationship management (CRM) platforms
  • Ability to demonstrate strategic critical thinking and focused, executable decision making
  • Highly organized, able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
  • Must be able to travel throughout designated territory to customer sites and other business locations in the USA as required

https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/point-of-care-testing

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world?

At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare.  For everyone. Everywhere.

Our global team : We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture : We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world.  We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers .

Join our team as Senior Director– Strategic Accounts/IDN. Success in this role is to work as a collective team to the transition from a transactional relationship to a trusted advisor with assigned strategic accounts. Directors are expected to collaborate and create internal velocity (without direct authority) across the organization to exceed expectations set by leadership and grow the overall cross-portfolio share for Siemens Healthineers.

Territory assigned: NorthEast

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Senior Director, you will be responsible for:

  • Success in this role is the transition from a transactional relationship with a customer to a trusted a trusted advisor
  • In assigned IDN accounts be responsible for all business elements of the entire Siemens Healthineers Portfolio.  To include Laboratory Diagnostics, Point of Care Diagnostics, Advanced Therapies, Diagnostic Imaging, Enterprise and Customer Services.
  • Participate in the development and execution of identified strategies in conjunction with internal stakeholder teammates in order to drive overall performance and growth.
  • Senior Directors are expected to lead (without direct authority) a cross-functional organization to exceed expectations set by leadership and grow the overall cross-portfolio share for Siemens Healthineers.
  • Where relevant, any elements in a deal cycle management may fall under the role of the Senior Director; business review cadence, coordination and negotiation of contractual activities (RFI, RFP…etc.), pipeline management, purchase commitment functions (obtain PO), order completion (delivery, payment) …etc
  • Value-add Elements to their IDN Accounts and also exploring the potential of entering into a value partnership and TOP agreements with those accounts

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers:

  • Senior Directors must be able to develop, influence, and sustain relationships with key IDN decision makers as well has have an in-depth understanding of key customer processes that aide the Siemens Healthineers organization to succeed.
  • Senior Directors must maintain an understanding of the macro healthcare market, health system operations and purchasing processes, service line development and reimbursement, and operational efficiency.
  • Senior Directors must be able to command the executive presence both internally and externally by articulating larger value proposition across the Healthineers portfolio.
  • The role seeks to understand assigned IDNs strategic goals by listening, engaging, and problem-solving w/ the customer in order to connect to value propositions and strategies where Siemens Healthineers can deliver improved outcomes for customers.
  • It is essential for a Senior Director to be able to translate and effectively communicate the value clinical, operational, and financial impact of the Healthineers portfolio and how it is influenced by the complexities between payors, providers, and patients.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and innovative thinking will aide those in this role to proactively participate in the creation and execution of Account Management Strategy.  Senior Directors will facilitate development and execution of strategies through by working with cross-functional teammates to meet time and action-based deliverables.
  • The Senior Director is a leader in the Siemens Healthineers organization and must be counted on to work collaborative with all Healthineers Stakeholders.  The Senior Director is expected to have a significant level of understanding and insight into the customers assigned to their responsibility.

Required skills & knowledge to have for the success of this role:

  • Bachelor’s degree with advanced degree preferred.
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in the healthcare industry with a proven trend of increases in responsibility working either within a health system in a service line leadership role capacity, or with an innovation supplier (manufacture) selling into senior leadership levels (VP and above).
  • Willing to travel up to 60%

At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose:  To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.

The pay range for this position is $154,000 – 212,000 annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The annual bonus target is variable compensation and this position is Siemens Healthineers offers a variety of health and wellness benefits including paid time off and holiday pay. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://benefitsatshs.com/index.html

This information is provided per the required states Pay Transparency Laws. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Siemens Healthineers external or internal careers site.

These scammers may attempt to collect your confidential personal or financial information. If you are concerned that an offer of employment with Siemens Healthineers might be a scam or that the recruiter is not legitimate, please verify by searching for the posting on the Siemens Healthineers Career Site .

If you want to join us in transforming the way healthcare is delivered, visit our career site at https://jobs.siemens-healthineers.com/careers

If you wish to find out more about the specific position before applying, please visit: https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/about

Apply now for the position of Delivery Team Order Manager and you will support the Order Management team within the Customer Supply Chain area.


Your role:

  • You review purchase orders received from customers, review and release newly created purchase orders based on internal approval guidelines, create & release purchase order to vendors, create all Mechanical installation vendor purchase orders in a timely fashion.
  • You book orders or review booked orders to ensure completeness and correctness based on customer contract pricing.
  • You validate and approve all invoice postings from 3rd party vendors via the Siemens IOL Portal
  • You generate all invoice requirements including but not limited to down payments, delivery invoice and final invoice.
  • You transact all revenue recognition requirements including but not limited to GR, IR, PGI and rev rec.
  • You receive, validate and process all change orders including generation and submittal of one-way or two way letters.
  • You engage in dispute resolution and provide post-delivery issue resolution
  • You provide daily delivery updates to all stakeholders

Your expertise:

  • You have attained a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant experience required
  • You have SAP experience
  • You have good PC skills (MS Office software like Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook)
  • You have worked in a high-volume orders, purchase or contract pricing environment preferably in healthcare or medical device industries
  • You show team orientation, communication skills and customer orientation.

Who we are:

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

How we work:

When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site at https://jobs.siemens-healthineers.com/careers

Apply now for the position of Point of Care Customer Experience Specialist, (CES) to p rovide support along every phase of the customer journey for all key accounts within their designated territory.

Your role:

  • Assist in the assessment of new opportunities and crafting key account plans alongside your partner Account Executive (AE)
  • Deliver reagent, instrument and informatics volume utilization as directed by key account plans and POC performance targets
  • Increase and maintain customer loyalty that delivers continual product retention and customer feedback scores at or ahead of promoted classification
  • Complete pre-sales activities and assess current workflows and evaluate the needs and goals of the customer – including support, training and implementation
  • Act in project management capacity with customers for implementations, go-live installations and support of informatics / middleware connectivity with POC devices
  • Identify customer needs and requirements, including pre and post analytical reviews, in support of the successful adoption of POC technology by end users in key accounts
  • Perform all EPOC installation and implementation requirements in customer sites as appropriate
  • Subject matter expert for all SHS and competitive emergency, critical and primary care product lines (and competitors) both technically & clinically. Strong functional understanding of POC Informatics and customer information interfaces
  • Assist the partner AE throughout the sales cycle to assess and position the optimal workflow and effectiveness solutions to meet the needs of the customer
  • Develop and coordinate the customer training, implementation, and go-live plan in conjunction with customer service to ensure that the account meets or exceeds implementation timelines and end-user proficiency over product usage lifecycles
  • Work with customers to establish training and verification/validation requirements and conduct troubleshooting activities
  • Develop adoption strategies that focus on best practice change management and monitor the onboarding of customers (stakeholder engagement, change management, implementation plans) towards to increase the use of our Point of Care (POC) products
  • Assist the customer in establishing & maintaining standardizations, standing orders and best practices post go-lives
  • In partnership with the AE, perform regular business reviews at required intervals including the assessment of error rates, reagent and consumable ordering, service contract management, customer satisfaction, potential unmet needs, improvement ideas, etc. with a view to further develop the partnership with the account
  • In partnership with the AE, work to review and target customers with a legacy install base, to determine to optimal solutions for the customer and the company
  • Work with key accounts and stakeholders to establish laboratory requirements (eg., CLIA, CAP, JCAHO)
  • Liaise between sales, technical, service and PMO organizations to drive a positive and seamless customer experience
  • Communicate product update and improvement information to customers in accordance with regulatory, quality and compliance guidelines
  • Demonstrate and/or socialize all of Siemens Healthineers products and services to develop the customer partnership further and foster customer loyalty
  • Document all customer activities in the appropriate customer relationship management (CRM), Quality Management System (QMS) and/or other tools and processes in a timely and compliant manner as required
  • Ensure that all detailed sales forecasting, training modules, and required reporting, including in all required internal quality and other tools and processes, are completed promptly and accurately
  • Attend and present at local, regional, and national conferences as subject matter experts
  • Work with internal teams such as Marketing to develop and maintain relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs)

Your expertise:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a biological science, nursing, or respiratory therapy
  • 4+ years of work history as a medical technologist, point of care coordinator, respiratory therapist, or nurse
  • Point of care testing experience, either end user or oversight is preferred
  • Experience in lean six-sigma and/or complex project management within a hospital or laboratory setting
  • Outstanding oral, written and presentation communication skills that can be applied to customers, with the ability to present technical information in a clear and concise manner to drive sales success
  • Highly proficient in the use of sales and customer relationship management (CRM) platforms
  • Ability to demonstrate strategic critical thinking and focused, executable decision making
  • Highly organized, able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
  • Must be able to travel throughout designated territory to customer sites and other business locations in the USA as required

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at :

https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/point-of-care-testing

  • Develop adoption strategies that focus on best practice change management and monitor the onboarding of customers (stakeholder engagement, change management, implementation plans) towards to increase the use of our Point of Care (POC) products
  • Assist the customer in establishing & maintaining standardizations, standing orders and best practices post go-lives
  • In partnership with the AE, perform regular business reviews at required intervals including the assessment of error rates, reagent and consumable ordering, service contract management, customer satisfaction, potential unmet needs, improvement ideas, etc. with a view to further develop the partnership with the account
  • In partnership with the AE, work to review and target customers with a legacy install base, to determine to optimal solutions for the customer and the company
  • Work with key accounts and stakeholders to establish laboratory requirements (eg., CLIA, CAP, JCAHO)
  • Liaise between sales, technical, service and PMO organizations to drive a positive and seamless customer experience
  • Communicate product update and improvement information to customers in accordance with regulatory, quality and compliance guidelines
  • Demonstrate and/or socialize all of Siemens Healthineers products and services to develop the customer partnership further and foster customer loyalty
  • Document all customer activities in the appropriate customer relationship management (CRM), Quality Management System (QMS) and/or other tools and processes in a timely and compliant manner as required
  • Ensure that all detailed sales forecasting, training modules, and required reporting, including in all required internal quality and other tools and processes, are completed promptly and accurately
  • Attend and present at local, regional, and national conferences as subject matter experts
  • Work with internal teams such as Marketing to develop and maintain relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs)

Your expertise:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a biological science, nursing, or respiratory therapy
  • 4+ years of work history as a medical technologist, point of care coordinator, respiratory therapist, or nurse
  • Point of care testing experience, either end user or oversight is preferred
  • Experience in lean six-sigma and/or complex project management within a hospital or laboratory setting
  • Outstanding oral, written and presentation communication skills that can be applied to customers, with the ability to present technical information in a clear and concise manner to drive sales success
  • Highly proficient in the use of sales and customer relationship management (CRM) platforms
  • Ability to demonstrate strategic critical thinking and focused, executable decision making
  • Highly organized, able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
  • Must be able to travel throughout designated territory to customer sites and other business locations in the USA as required

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at :

https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/point-of-care-testing

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries.   • Assist the customer in establishing & maintaining standardizations, standing orders and best practices post go-lives
  • In partnership with the AE, perform regular business reviews at required intervals including the assessment of error rates, reagent and consumable ordering, service contract management, customer satisfaction, potential unmet needs, improvement ideas, etc. with a view to further develop the partnership with the account
  • In partnership with the AE, work to review and target customers with a legacy install base, to determine to optimal solutions for the customer and the company
  • Work with key accounts and stakeholders to establish laboratory requirements (eg., CLIA, CAP, JCAHO)
  • Liaise between sales, technical, service and PMO organizations to drive a positive and seamless customer experience
  • Communicate product update and improvement information to customers in accordance with regulatory, quality and compliance guidelines
  • Demonstrate and/or socialize all of Siemens Healthineers products and services to develop the customer partnership further and foster customer loyalty
  • Document all customer activities in the appropriate customer relationship management (CRM), Quality Management System (QMS) and/or other tools and processes in a timely and compliant manner as required
  • Ensure that all detailed sales forecasting, training modules, and required reporting, including in all required internal quality and other tools and processes, are completed promptly and accurately
  • Attend and present at local, regional, and national conferences as subject matter experts
  • Work with internal teams such as Marketing to develop and maintain relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs)

Your expertise:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a biological science, nursing, or respiratory therapy
  • 4+ years of work history as a medical technologist, point of care coordinator, respiratory therapist, or nurse
  • Point of care testing experience, either end user or oversight is preferred
  • Experience in lean six-sigma and/or complex project management within a hospital or laboratory setting
  • Outstanding oral, written and presentation communication skills that can be applied to customers, with the ability to present technical information in a clear and concise manner to drive sales success
  • Highly proficient in the use of sales and customer relationship management (CRM) platforms
  • Ability to demonstrate strategic critical thinking and focused, executable decision making
  • Highly organized, able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
  • Must be able to travel throughout designated territory to customer sites and other business locations in the USA as required

https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/point-of-care-testing

Job Title: Intracardiac Echocardiography (ICE) Clinical Specialist, OH - MI
Job Description:
Job Description

Job ID

419773

Company

Siemens Medical Solutions USA, Inc.

Organization

Siemens Healthineers

Job Family

Sales

Experience Level

Experienced Professional

Full Time / Part Time

Full-time

Remote vs Office

Remote Only

Permanent

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Intracardiac Echocardiography (ICE) Clinical Specialist and provide technical and clinical product support to health care providers and laboratory staff for diagnostic catheters and ultrasound systems, with an emphasis on Structural Heart.

Your role:

The ICE Clinical Specialist (ICS) is accountable to provide technical and clinical product support to health care providers and laboratory staff for diagnostic catheters and ultrasound systems – with an emphasis on Structural Heart and the ACUSON AcuNav Volume ICE catheter utilization.

The ICS actively participates in internal/external trainings, maintains optimal 2D/4D workflow techniques and has a strong competitive knowledge. Close collaboration between Area Directors of Sales, VP of ICE Sales, and ICE Clinical Specialists is required to ensure that all clinical objectives and sales goals are achieved.

  • Provide clinical product and technical assistance and training to physicians and staff on the effective use of AcuNav Volume (ICE) Catheter in the cardiac interventional or electrophysiology laboratories.
  • Use consultative selling techniques to identify potential sales opportunities within the account.
  • Maximize customer case support capability through proper planning and scheduling techniques.
  • Stay current on company products instructions for use, best practices, and technical troubleshooting, as well as relevant scientific clinical literature and new product information.
  • Prioritize and appropriately respond to requests in a high stress environment and maintain composure and problem-solving focus during stressful interactions.
  • Engage in diagnostic dialogue with multiple internal and external business partners and stakeholders, and formulate solutions based on dialogue and input gained during session.
  • Actively participates in internal/external trainings, maintains optimal scanning techniques and competitive knowledge.

Your expertise:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
  • A minimum 3 years experience in clinical echocardiography lab with focus on structural heart and 3D/4D imaging or equivalent in industry experience.
  • Certification as a Registered Cardiac Sonographer (RCS) or as a Registered Diagnostic Cardiac Sonographer (RDCS) in adult or pediatric echocardiography ideal.
  • Maintains clinical knowledge of healthcare industry, disease states, therapeutic and institutional trends.
  • Willing and able to travel up to 75% overnight locally, regionally, and nationally, sometimes on short notice, must live within reasonable distance to airport.
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time, working in a hospital laboratory setting, attending live patient cases, and wearing protective gear (i.e. lead aprons), and willing to work variable hours to meet customer needs.

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at : https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/ultrasound

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Market Insights Manager, and you will be part of a team that is responsible for delivering market data and insights to guide the strategic planning of our Diagnostics operation and provides critical insights at a headquarter and business line level.

Your role:

  • You will be responsible for staying abreast of relevant market reports, news, and activities in the industry (e.g., changes in regulations, new technology, emerging diseases), inferring implications on the In Vitro Diagnostics sector; communicate and deliver insights to key company stakeholders
  • You will provide global and regional market insights to the Diagnostics division, including Core Lab, Specialty Lab, and Point-of-Care business lines, based on primary and/or secondary research and analytics
  • You will build and maintain build and maintain quarterly and annual market models, including historical, current, and forecast (e.g., 1-, 5-, and 10- year forecasts)
  • You will work with regions, business lines, and functions to establish market estimates, ensuring alignment between various stakeholders (i.e. top-down and bottom-up approach)
  • You will lead ad-hoc market analysis and special projects (e.g., Capital Market Day updates)

Your expertise:

  • 2+ years in market research, competitive intelligence, and/or analytical/financial modeling in the In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) industry or a related field or MBA and 1+ years experience
  • In depth understanding of the IVD market, its players, and technologies
  • Strong business acumen, analytical, and interpersonal skills
  • Able to create a network across the organization (Headquarter and Regions)
  • Ability to listen to and interpret qualitative and quantitative data, synthesizes data into an understandable narrative, and effectively communicates findings to stakeholders

Job Description:
Job Description

Job ID

Siemens Healthineers

Sales

Experienced Professional

Full Time / Part Time

Full-time

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Competitive Insights Manager, and you will be part of a team that supports the overall strategic planning of our Diagnostics operation and provides critical insights at a headquarter and business line level.

Your role:

  • You will build and manage a comprehensive competitive intelligence approach that delivers on-going timely competitive insights, including performance updates, portfolio management, strategy developments, etc. and communicate these insights in a clear, structured, and timely manner
  • You would manage the quarterly and annual financial tracking of competitor and market performance, including earnings, business/product line, and regional analysis
  • You will lead ad-hoc market competitive analysis and special projects
  • (e.g., benchmarking),
  • You will support various teams across Siemens Healthineers with regards to their competitive insights requirements, including Headquarter, Core Lab Solutions, Specialty Lab Solutions, and Point-of-Care
  • You will leverage and interpret public domain, primary, and third-party resources, and critical thinking, to provide strategic insights
  • You will be tasked with understanding customer needs, requirements and any macro customer trends as related to competitive environment

Your expertise:

  • 2+ years in market research, competitive intelligence, and/or analytical/financial modeling in the In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) industry or a related field or  MBA and 1+ years experience
  • In depth understanding of the IVD market, its players, and technologies
  • Strong business acumen, analytical, and interpersonal skills
  • Able to create a network across the organization (Headquarter and Regions)
  • Ability to listen to and interpret qualitative and quantitative data, synthesizes data into an understandable narrative, and effectively communicates findings to stakeholders

Who we are:
We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

How we work:
When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site at Careers - Siemens Healthineers USA (siemens-healthineers.com)

The pay range for this position is $114,000 - $155,00 U.S. dollars annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience, as well as where the work will be performed. The annual incentive target is (8%) of base pay. Siemens Healthineers offers a variety of health and wellness benefits including paid time off and holiday pay. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://benefitsatshs.com/index.html

This information is provided per the required state Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Siemens Healthineers external or internal careers site.

Apply now for the position Territory Clinical Specialist, Cardiology, cardiology sonographer responsible for providing exceptional sales support with product demonstrations and on-site technical applications training for Siemens Ultrasound Cardiology Imaging systems.

Your role:

The Territory Clinical Specialist, Card is a registered sonographer position with overall responsibility for providing sales support during product demonstrations as well as providing on-site technical applications training for Siemens Ultrasound Cardiology Imaging systems at customer medical facilities. This role assists in the sales process through product demonstrations and promotion of new product and upgrades to achieve regional and corporate sales/marketing goals.

• Primary responsibility assisting the sales process through product demonstrations and customer interactions to achieve regional and corporate sales/marketing goals.

• Provide ongoing customer support through product installations, upgrades, phone support and training programs. Maintains knowledge of current trends in all products within their modality.

• Able to strategically plan and perform demonstrations that result in clear differentiation of the products both clinically and technically, as well as provide the clinical and business solution (value) to each specific customer.

• Accomplished using active listening and conflict resolution skills and customize presentation to audience in competitive activities, handle customer objections, and product issues.

• Works collaboratively as a partner of the sales team to meet company objectives and provide optimal customer support within their region.

•  Effectively plan and implement training programs, providing a high degree of professionalism.

• Able to adjust teaching style to address specific customer learning curves, personalities, and complexities within their specific institution.

• Supports national and regional trade shows.

Your expertise:

  • Associates or Bachelors degree along with a minimum of 4+ years of clinical experience as a cardiac sonographer and typically some experience with commercial preferable.
  • Registered through the RDCS in cardiology ultrasound imaging and typically other certifications, RDMS, RVT a plus.
  • Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.
  • Demonstrates a basic knowledge of computer skills.
  • Holds a valid driver’s license.
  • Willingness to travel extensively to support company goals, up to 75% of the time. (Average 3 overnights per week).

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at : https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/ultrasound

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

This is a key role having the overall accountability to achieving sales success and growth for Siemens Healthineers by developing customised solutions for our customers.

The Healthcare Solutions (HCS) Consultant provides provision of consulting services to diagnostic customers. The HCS consultant will visit hospital laboratories to collect information from the customer site and determine the best solution to fulfil customer needs with Siemens Healthineers portfolio. They will elaborate workflow recommendations and communicates the results of the analysis with the commercial team, and customer.

Focusing on three key areas:

In the pre-sales phase, they will:

- Be responsible for evaluating the current situation in the lab and design the solution based on the analysis (with the necessary sales arguments)
- They will prepare, floor plans and presentations for customers and supports the team in tender responses, especially for complex and automation projects
During the implementation phase, they will:
- Collaborate with the Project Manager (PM) IT and Service Team to support on a smooth transition; and verifies that the designed workflow during the pre-sales is implemented, proposing adjustment if needed

In the post-sales phase, the consultant performs:

- Lab optimization on strategic and selected accounts focusing on lab instruments and automation performance to evaluate the lab workflow and processes
- They will be responsible for identifying areas of improvement and quantify it to generate value to customer and Siemens Healthineers through business opportunities

The healthcare consultant will have direct interaction with customers (in different levels of the organization) and internally with sales, IT, projects marketing, and other departments. It’s required availability to travel inside the country and international (up to 60% of time).

This is done through workflow and data analysis and is developed in collaboration with other colleagues within the commercial organisation. Upon winning automation business then engage with customers as they Transition their processes, guiding and mentoring them to get from current to future state with the most efficient processes possible. Engage with customers throughout the solution lifecycle to maintain and improve the efficiency of the solution. To provide workflow consultation and solutions to improve customers operations.

Essential requirements:

- Background in pathology, preferably in a laboratory environment
- Previous experience in healthcare consulting and development solutions
- Degree level education in sciences
- Experience in similar role

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare.  For everyone. Everywhere.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as Territory Clinical Specialist for Ultrasound.

Our global team: We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world.  We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers .

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Territory Clinical Specialist, Ultrasound you have responsibility for product demonstration and technical application to our ultrasound product customers.

Position Overview

The Territory Clinical Specialist is a registered sonographer position with overall responsibility for providing sales support during product demonstrations as well as providing on-site technical applications training for Siemens Ultrasound Imaging systems at customer medical facilities. This role assists in the sales process through product demonstrations and customer interactions to achieve regional and corporate sales/marketing goals.

Provides expert technical training and delivers excellent customer service. Additionally, you will be responsible in assisting in the growth of our business through promotion of new products and upgrades. Maintains knowledge of current trends in ultrasound to support customers as capabilities of products are developed and released. Supports company goals in all interactions with customers and employees.

This role reports to the Zone Clinical Director within the Healthineers Division.

Responsibilities

• Performs pre-sale demonstration for the Siemens ultrasound product line

• Provide expert technical training while delivering excellent customer service

• Assists in the growth of our business through promotion of new products and upgrades

• Works closely with the sales team to optimize product and image quality for the customer

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

• Typically requires an Associate’s degree along with a minimum of 4+ years of clinical experience as a general imaging sonographer and typically some experience with commercial clinical.

• Qualified candidate must be registered through the RDMS in general ultrasound imaging and typically other certifications.

• Must have excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.

• Demonstrates a basic knowledge of computer skills.

• Willingness to travel extensively to support company goals, up to 75% of the time. (Average 3 overnights per week).


Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

• Individuals with additional certifications (i.e., RDCS or RVT) will be given preference.

• Past commercial clinical experience preferred, 2 or more years ideal.

• Demonstrates ability to fully understand and present the technology associated with each key platform, possesses an excellent understanding of ultrasound physics.

The pay range for this position is $105,000-$125,000 annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The annual incentive target is $15,000.
