Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world?

At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare.  For everyone. Everywhere.

Our global team: We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world.  We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers .

Join our team as Senior Director - Strategic Corporate Accounts, Diagnostics (Central Zone). Success in this role is to work as a collective team to the transition from a transactional relationship to a trusted advisor with assigned strategic accounts. Directors are expected to collaborate and create internal velocity (without direct authority) across the organization to exceed expectations set by leadership and grow the overall cross-portfolio share for Siemens Healthineers.

Territory assigned: Central Zone (must reside within this geography)

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Senior Director , you will be responsible for:

  • Success in this role is the transition from a transactional relationship with a customer to a trusted advisor.
  • In assigned Strategic accounts, including Value Partnership prospects as well as strategic IDNs, be responsible for all business elements of the entire Siemens Healthineers Portfolio.  To include Laboratory Diagnostics, Point of Care Diagnostics, and Customer Services.
  • Participate in the development and execution of identified strategies in conjunction with internal stakeholder teammates in order to drive overall performance and growth.
  • Senior Directors are expected to lead (without direct authority) a cross-functional organization to exceed expectations set by leadership and grow the overall cross-portfolio share for Siemens Healthineers.
  • Where relevant, any elements in a deal cycle management may fall under the role of the Senior Director; business review cadence, coordination and negotiation of contractual activities (RFI, RFP…etc.), pipeline management, purchase commitment functions (obtain PO), order completion (delivery, payment) etc

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers

  • Senior Directors must be able to develop, influence, and sustain relationships with key SCA decision makers as well has have an in-depth understanding of key customer processes that aide the Siemens Healthineers organization to succeed.
  • Senior Directors must maintain an understanding of the macro healthcare market, health system operations and purchasing processes, service line development and reimbursement, and operational efficiency.
  • Senior Directors must be able to command the executive presence both internally and externally by articulating larger value proposition across the Healthineers portfolio.
  • The role seeks to understand assigned SCAs strategic goals by listening, engaging, and problem-solving w/ the customer in order to connect to value propositions and strategies where Siemens Healthineers can deliver improved outcomes for customers.
  • It is essential for a Senior Director to be able to translate and effectively communicate the value clinical, operational, and financial impact of the Healthineers portfolio and how it is influenced by the complexities between payors, providers, and patients.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and innovative thinking will aide those in this role to proactively participate in the creation and execution of Account Management Strategy.  Senior Directors will facilitate development and execution of strategies through by working with cross-functional teammates to meet time and action-based deliverables.
  • The Senior Director is a leader in the Siemens Healthineers organization and must be counted on to work collaborative with all Healthineers Stakeholders.  The Senior Director is expected to have a significant level of understanding and insight into the customers assigned to their responsibility.

Required skills & knowledge to have for the success of this role

  • Bachelor’s degree with advanced degree preferred.
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in the healthcare industry with consultative and direct sales experience
  • Laboratory Diagnostics experience required
  • Willing to travel up to 60%

Apply now for the position of Territory Clinical Specialist, Ultrasound and manage product demonstrations and technical applications to our ultrasound product customers.

Your role:

The Territory Clinical Specialist is a registered sonographer position with overall responsibility for providing sales support during product demonstrations as well as providing on-site technical applications training for Siemens Ultrasound Imaging systems at customer medical facilities. This role assists in the sales process through product demonstrations and customer interactions to achieve regional and corporate sales/marketing goals.

Provides expert technical training and delivers excellent customer service. Additionally, you will be responsible in assisting in the growth of our business through promotion of new products and upgrades. Maintains knowledge of current trends in ultrasound to support customers as capabilities of products are developed and released. Supports company goals in all interactions with customers and employees.

This role reports to the Zone Clinical Director within the Healthineers Division.

• You perform pre-sale demonstration for the Siemens ultrasound product line

• You provide expert technical training while delivering excellent customer service

• You assist in the growth of our business through promotion of new products and upgrades

• You work closely with the sales team to optimize product and image quality for the customer

Your expertise:

• Minimum of 4+ years of clinical experience as a general imaging sonographer and typically some experience with commercial clinical.

• Registration through the RDMS in general ultrasound imaging and typically other certifications, RDCS, RVT.

• Excellent communication skills, written, verbal and solid presentation skills.

• Basic computer skills, Microsoft Office products.

• Willingness to travel extensively to support company goals, up to 75% of the time. (Average 3 overnights per week).

• Able to fully understand and present the technology associated with each key platform, with an excellent understanding of ultrasound physics.

Apply now for the position of Senior Marketing Manager, General Imaging Ultrasound, NAM and you will join our innovative Ultrasound team based in Issaquah, WA. This is a key position on the North America ultrasound marketing team with strong ties into sales, strategy, and product development. You will make a significant impact that drives positive change and leads to improved financial results by executing strategies and tactics that grow market share for our General Imaging ultrasound portfolio.

This is a hybrid position in our Issaquah, WA office.

Your Role:

  • Analyze and understand the North America General Imaging ultrasound market segment. Identify marketing strategies, customer needs, competitive trends, etc. to formulate a plan for market share and revenue growth.
  • Partner with the North America sales organization to execute strategies and tactics that drive achievement of revenue targets by generating awareness, brand loyalty and intent to purchase with customers.
  • Responsible for identifying and creating marketing assets to support sales and growth initiatives for our General Imaging business - print and digital advertising, product pricing, sales promotions, product support, new product launches, ROI value propositions, key opinion leader development, evidentiary endorsements, and white papers.
  • Lead strategy and planning for North American General Imaging tradeshows.
  • Develop unique marketing campaigns, tactics and sales enablement tools that focus on how our portfolio: improves patient outcomes, increases clinician and patient satisfaction, reduces costs, and increases patient access to a much-needed imaging modality.
  • Lead go-to-market activities for new product launches in North America by creating a plan that generates awareness and demand with our customers while also ensuring the sales team has what they need to successfully launch the product.

Your Expertise:

  • Understanding of customers and their imaging needs and how Siemens Healthineers ultrasound can address those needs through systems, software, service, and commercial solutions.
  • Demonstrated experience creating and executing regional go-to-market plans on time and on budget.
  • Ability to complete competitive analysis and identify market trends.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work with internal and external stakeholders to achieve objectives; including but not limited to field sales, legal, regulatory, compliance, clinical, finance, executive management, etc.
  • Strong work ethic with a high degree of self-motivation and the ability to work independently.
  • Excellent organizational skills with the ability to deliver multiple tasks and projects simultaneously while meeting challenging deadlines.

Required Skills, Education and Experience for this position:

  • Master’s degree or MBA preferred.
  • 5-8 years of progressive marketing experience in Cardiology / MedTech / Biotech preferred.
  • The ability to travel 20-30% of the time.
  • Marketer with ultrasound clinical or sales experience is a plus.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Strong critical and creative thinking skills. Strategic thinker and planner.

The pay range for this position is $120,000.00-$140,000.00 U.S. dollars annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience, as well as where the work will be performed. The annual incentive target 10%.  Siemens Healthineers offers a variety of health and wellness benefits including paid time off and holiday pay.   Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://benefitsatshs.com/index.html

Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company with over 170 years of experience and 18,000 patents. More than 66,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. We stand with our customers around the world to support them in delivering high quality care to their patients. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services. This is what truly matters to us.

Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as a CRM Application Manager focused on the Lead to Opportunity CRM Sales Process

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a CRM Application Manager , you will be responsible for:
  • Identifying, understanding, and solving Customer Relationship Management (CRM) related issues
  • Managing projects consisting of various departments (e.g. IT, external vendors, country sales and sales support staff) to provide digital CRM related solutions
  • Establishing and executing plans to ensure the quality and effectiveness of those solutions
  • Product Owner for a digital product and/or application within the CRM lead to opportunity arena, including customer-facing application interactions
  • Communicating effectively with various stakeholders throughout the understanding and solutioning processes
  • Driving innovation CRM projects or prototyping workstreams for early customer validation and leading idea generation as well as evaluation of innovative ideas in regards to their future business potential
This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to develop your career with Healthineers:
  • The complete software development life cycle (including requirement management) and the application of the Agile methodology
  • Determining the root cause of business problems and developing business cases showing the value in solving them
  • Developing and executing project plans and leading project teams; developing and grooming a product backlog
  • Change Management - including communication planning and execution, and ensuring user adoption of digital CRM solutions
  • The pain points surrounding the sellers of today and sales managers – preferably in a Healthcare market
  • Oracle Sales Cloud or other large commercial CRM platforms - including opportunity, account & contact management, sales engagement and marketing/sales connections
  • Applying Healthineers Performance System principles and/or Lean/Six Sigma concepts
  • Working with project members to establish innovative thinking and creativity
Required skills to have for the success of this role:
  • 5+ years of Business Analysis, Data Analysis, IT Analysis, Project Management, Product Owner, Sales Support
  • Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree preferred
  • Strong business communication skills, including written, verbal, and presentation skills
  • Project management skills with the ability to motivate and lead project teams
  • Some experience in innovation processes, leading cross-functional teams, and culture of experimentation would be a benefit

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

If you are a talented and experienced Technical Specialist, Sales or Product Manager looking to progress your career or take on a new challenge in a company looking to make a difference to patient lives, we want to hear from you. Siemens Healthineers is looking for a Product Manager, Informatics, to support our achievement of ambitious growth.

The role of Product Manager is to manage your portfolio and be an expert in your field. Working across exciting initiatives, you will the product expert as well as strategically deciding the route to market and launching new products.

As a Product Manager, you will collaborate closely with the UK and Ireland POC sales team and other Product Managers to help build solutions to customer’s needs and promote the business internally and externally.

As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for:

• The detailed presentation of the Siemens Point of Care Informatics software products throughout the GBI Zone
• You will collaborate closely with the GBI POC sales team to qualify new customers and develop appropriate IT solutions for customers
• You will support the sales team in presenting specific solutions to the customers and preparing quotations for Informatics products
• You will collaborate closely with the POC Informatics implementation and support team, and will take part in sales meetings with the POC Informatics organization
• You will support the sales team in preparing sales forecast and sales pipeline reports for the POC Informatics portfolio
• You will be a key contributor for POC Informatics into tender responses
• You will develop and maintain customer relationships, in relation to POC Informatics, who may be end users or B2B partners
• Launch of new products
• You will use feedback from the sales team for product improvements, and will support EMEA and global Marketing in conducting market and competitor analyses for existing and new products

Your qualifications and experience:

• You have a degree or a diploma and several years of professional experience in sales or support, ideally for software or medical products
• You have sound IT skills (servers, operating systems, MS SQL databases, IT networks)
• You ideally have knowledge in the field of healthcare, preferably relating to in-vitro or in-vivo diagnostics
• You possess outstanding verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and have the ability to explain complex interrelationships clearly and vividly

Your attributes and skills:

• You are willing to undertake business travel (could be up to 50%) within the Zone
• You bring excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills and have the ability to explain complex issues simply and clearly
• You have a strong talent for identifying solutions even in complicated customer situations
• You are a highly organized team player with a strong motivation and passion for finding solutions for customers
• If you enjoy working with customers and developing complex solutions, we look forward to receiving your application

Who we are:

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Job Description:

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare.  For everyone. Everywhere.
We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as Global Marketing Competitive Solutions Lead to improve patient lives around the globe.
Our global team: We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.
Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world.  We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers.

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. This is a Director level individual contributor role. As a Global Marketing Competitive Solutions Lead you will be responsible for:

• Thoroughly understanding competitive offerings and provide commercial organizations with appropriate positioning and tools to differentiate product(s) versus the competition in a profitable manner that adds value to the customer.
• Analyzing and synthesizing key competitive wins, competitive intelligence, and market research to lead the development of specific strategies to beat the competition.
• Developing go-to-market strategies & campaigns with detailed competitive playbooks aligned by portfolio.
• Leveraging the Zone organizations and their top closers experience to build deep competitive knowledge and serve as a critical connector to share competitive intelligence and best practices across the globe.
• Collecting, codifying and assisting in the appropriate best practice transfer of successful local/zone initiatives that deliver product goals in line with Atellica brand strategy, combining compliance to global strategy with local relevance.
• Develop educational programs and tools to train sales teams worldwide to quantify and sell the value of our competitive and differentiating solutions.
• Monitoring, tracking Competition moves in the market and support portfolio leads with inputs for portfolio positioning
• Supports the Marketing teams with inputs to improve our portfolio positioning against competition and supports the development of directed sales and marketing campaigns to increase market share gains
• Support commercial discussions with zones on business performance against competition and performance against Sales and Marketing Campaigns.
• Close collaboration with strategy team to track new competitive portfolio introduction and Market share development.
This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers

• Have an in-depth understanding of hospital and reference lab environments has in-depth knowledge of the competitive landscape of central laboratory solutions
• Shown demonstrated success in creating and quantifying value propositions to showcase the clinical, operational, and financial value of solutions
• Experience in developing and implementing sales training programs and tools
• Demonstrated ability to envision possibilities, lead teams and drive results

Required skills to have for the success of this role
• 5+ years of relevant commercial (sales, marketing) experience in healthcare. Must have laboratory diagnostics experience.
• Subject matter expertise in hospital and reference lab environments required, prior experience as a med-tech/laboratorian preferred
• Strong conceptual, analytical, and presentation skills
• Collaborative with ability to work across business lines and partner to build consensus and achieve results
• Demonstrated ability to effectively manage across the matrix in the context of a large global company.
• Previous experience in both Global Marketing and Country Marketing roles a plus.
• Bachelor degree in business; life sciences; engineering or related technical discipline. MBA is preferred

Desirable Characteristics

• Has an endless abundance of curiosity for the customer, the market, trends, etc.
• Has a customer-driven mentality, representing the customer in all decisions
• Challenges the status quo and acts as a change agent
• Is resourceful and takes ownership to find solutions to business challenges
• Thinks strategically, asking ‘why?’ and ‘what value will this bring?’ when making choices
• Is high-energy, agile and competitive with a bias for action to get solutions to the market quickly
• Demonstrates courage and thoughtfully manages risks
• Reaches out and connects well with people across the organization
• Can simplify and clarify things and explain them to others
• Is culturally savvy, crossing geographic boundaries
• Able to succeed in a matrix environment where collaboration and sharing responsibility for success and failure of others on the team is critical to the overall success of the company.  Ability to build consensus.

The pay range for this position is $163,000.00 - $220,000.00 annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The annual incentive target is 15% of base pay.  Siemens Healthineers offers a variety of health and wellness benefits including paid time off and holiday pay.   Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://benefitsatshs.com/index.html
This information is provided per the required state Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Siemens Healthineers external or internal careers site.

At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose:  To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.

Apply now for the position of Scientific Engagement Director , and you will help identify, develop, and manage ES research and innovation collaborations at strategic partner sites. In this role, you will :

  • Lead scientific relationship development to reach high and wide within the strategic partner organization and gain participation in strategic research & development sessions to identify and drive scientific goals of the strategic partner site.
  • ct as an advisor to customer executive management and business partners on research and innovation related topics
  • ollaborate closely with cross functional teams that include scientific collaborations from other business areas/lines (e.g. MRI, CT, Advanced Therapies, Lab Diagnostics, Digital & Automation, …), centralized operations, local equipment service & sales, advisory service consultants, procurement, quality, and vendor partners.

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Scientific Engagement Director, you will be responsible for :

· Represent Siemens Healthineers Research & Innovation at potential and established strategic partner sites

· Identify research and innovation topics of importance to the partner site that can also lead to publications and/or extramural grant applications

· Represent Siemens Healthineers on steering committees with strategic partners

· Manage Research & Innovation projects and processes across the entire Siemens Healthineers spectrum (Lab, Imaging, Digital Health, Therapy & Health Economics)

· Align with collaboration leads of other business lines

· Engage subject matter experts from Siemens Healthineers as needed

· Work with legal, research, compliance, clinical affairs and logistics personnel (internally and across the strategic partner network) to develop research agreements that define the required equipment, funding and deliverables for each research project. Teaching lectures / courses at strategic partner site, if applicable

Required skills to have for the success of this role

· Doctorate degree in Engineering, Biochemistry, Health Economics, Medicine, or Physics

· 10+ years of successful experience in medical research & innovation

· Outstanding written and verbal communication skills

· Strong presentation skills

· Ability to translate complex scientific information to audiences ranging from laymen to expert

· Comfortable to speak to C-Level Executives and Government Officials

· Ability to work independently and within a large team

· Ability to think strategically

Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company with over 170 years of experience and 18,000 patents. More than 48,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. We stand with our customers around the world to support them in delivering high quality care to their patients. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services. This is what truly matters to us.

Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as Financial Analyst within the Diagnostics Performance Controlling

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Financial Analyst 6 , you will be responsible for :

  • Leading the implementation of new reporting processes and tools within Diagnostics Finance based on regulative and tax documents.
  • Develops the Diagnostics governance across functions and legal entities including harmonization of processes, regulations and definitions.
  • Responsible for Diagnostics Global scenario modeling of business plan and leading financial key performance indicators.
  • Preparing executive level reports and financial presentations.
  • Leading the incentive process for Diagnostics, developing and implementing new incentive structure in close alignment with Diagnostics management and Healthineers headquarter.
  • Support of Diagnostics productivity analysis, controlling, and management reporting including support in Productivity training and One Puma Web system.
  • Actively driving and developing initiatives and projects as well as preparing senior management alignments.

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers.

  • We are seeking someone who can think of the bigger picture and summarize topics clearly and precisely.  By developing a complete perspective of a situation and report the findings to senior leadership to help them make decisions that drive long term results.
  • Point of contact for Healthineers Accounting and Controlling team including addressing questions and providing updates.
  • Continuously enhance and improves existing policies as well as reporting and controlling methods and products.
  • Data and scenario modeling and analysis.
  • Experience in working with senior management and in complex global matrix organization.
  • Self-driven and resourceful to ensure that deadlines are met in high-quality.
  • Reliable team player willing to go the extra mile when necessary.

Required skills to have for the success of this role.

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in finance, Accounting, or other related field
  • Required experience: 10 + years.
  • Required amount of travel: <5%
  • Other required knowledge, skills, or expertise:    Advanced knowledge of MS Office Applications especially MS Excel, PowerPoint (ThinkCell)

Your Role:

  • Perform software installation and functional testing on finished medical ultrasound devices using PC based test tools.

  • Experience with personal computers, including typical office applications.
  • You are a strong communicator with good verbal and written communications skills.

  • You excel when working in a team environment.
  • Preferred minimum of 5-8 years manufacturing experience

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

At Siemens Healthineers, We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as Regional Service Manager.

Our global team : We are a team of more than 68,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture : We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers

• Service Area – Grand Rapids, MI Area

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Regional Service Manager, you will be responsible for :

· Managing the healthcare Field Service business by directing, coordinating, and leading the organization and its activities to meet customer service expectations and financial metrics. The Regional Service Manager reports to the Service Market Vice President of Siemens Healthineers.

Responsibilities

  • Work to maximize customer loyalty and satisfaction
  • Communicate the value proposition of Siemens service to customers
  • Obtaining service financial goals through revenue attainment and effective cost containment.
  • Ensure compliance with FDA Good Manufacturing Practices
  • Meet annual RSM goals and metrics as established
  • Hire, develop, train and coach Customer Service Engineers (CSE’s)
  • Prioritize customer and business objectives to provide clear direction to CSE’s
  • Ensure customer satisfaction through timely follow up on all issues
  • Key Customer and area Management
    • Develop long term value-based relationships with key accounts
    • Provide additional escalation support to resolve key account issues
    • Develop proactive account plans to prevent or predict issues
    • Provide continues communication across organization for key accounts

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

  • BS/BA in related discipline, or advanced degree, where required, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 8+ years of successful experience in a directly related field and successful demonstration of Key Responsibilities and Knowledge as presented above.
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Superior communication skills (written and oral) and ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders at many levels within the organization
  • Effectively present information to co-workers and employee groups, including upper management, customers at various levels and public representatives
  • Ability to read, analyze and translate into action financial profit and loss statements.
  • Professional level knowledge on using analytical databases and complex excel workbooks and associated pivot tables.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents
  • Ability to thrive as a member of a collaborative, cross-functional team
  • Competent knowledge of MS Office applications
  • Must have a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record over the last three years.

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

  • Experience in managing large, remote, employee-based territory
  • Knowledge of the Diagnostic Imaging Instruments or equivalent Diagnostic Imaging industry experience
  • Ability to articulate and explain value of Service Agreement offerings
  • Working knowledge of SAP or experience with equivalent enterprise service software solution

Apply now for the position of Laboratory Technician 3.

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Laboratory Technician 3 , you will be responsible for :

  • Participates in operating and maintaining laboratory equipment
  • Participates in laboratory work, follows common laboratory practice.
  • Support maintaining good laboratory documentation.
  • Participates in technical manipulations on animals.
  • Humanely handles and manipulates small/large animals to obtain the desired material.
  • Participates in the care and maintenance of animals.
  • Assists with semi-complex maintenance work to ensure a safe and clean laboratory and animal facility.

Required skills to have for the success of this role

  • Candidate must also have strong communication abilities, interpersonal skills, strong work ethics and be a team player.
  • HIgh School Diploma or GED.
  • Animal and laboratory experience preferred.

Location: Chicago, IL

Shift: Monday through Friday 8:00a to 5:00p

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Customer Service Engineer II , you will be responsible for :

  • You will be responsible for installing, troubleshooting, repairing and performing preventative maintenance on all Siemens Healthcare Diagnostics instrumentation (primarily Dimension and Vista Chemistry products) at customer sites with minimal supervision.
  • You will be responsible for delivering both timely and effective repairs as well as adequate training of operators to ensure optimal system performance, resulting in superior customer satisfaction.
  • You will manage financial performance within their territory, meeting or exceeding budget for revenue generation, expense control and inventory management.
  • You will manage company assets to include a company car, cell phone, computer, tools, inventory parts, etc.
  • Establish and maintain proper business relationships with customers and peers, as well as performing necessary administrative duties accurately.

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers

  • You have the ability and experience to establish and maintain proper business relationships with customers and peers, as well as performing necessary administrative duties accurately.

· You have experience in testing, repairing and maintaining capital medical equipment

· You have strong customer service and communication skills

· You are proficient in the use of tools and service test equipment

· You have experience in testing, repairing and maintaining capital medical equipment

Required skills to have for the success of this role

· Minimum high school diploma; technical Associates Degree or equivalent preferred.

· Must be proficient in the use of tools and service test equipment, with the ability to work both individually and in an established team setting.

· 5+ years experience as a medical technologist or field service engineer (biomedical engineer) servicing diagnostic instruments needed.

Must demonstrate excellent judgment in customer relations and in managing company resources; strong competency in instrument systems technology to include mechanics, electrical, chemistry, and software technology; experience with electronics, hydraulic and pneumatic systems.

Job Description:
Job Description

Job ID

417505

Company

Siemens Healthcare Diagnostics Inc.

Organization

Siemens Healthineers

Job Family

Product Management, Portfolio & Innovation

Experience Level

Experienced Professional

Full Time / Part Time

Full-time

Remote vs Office

Office/Site Only

Permanent

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Marketing Lead, Atellica Systems Chemistry Analyzers and you will drive products and strategy which improves the lives of patients globally.

Your role:

  • End to End Product Ownership: Responsibility for Chemistry instrument strategy, innovation, product launch, go-to-market, commercial positioning, and related campaigns. Owns Chemistry across all Atellica instrumentation and will drive a holistic solutions approach with product positioning.
  • Customer and Market Insights: Gain deep customer insights to serve as Atellica systems expert on customer targets (laboratorians, hospital administration, reference labs, ministries of health, etc.) building keen insights and understanding to contribute to the overall CLS business strategy.
  • Competitive Selling Strategies: Thoroughly understand competitive offerings and provide commercial organizations with appropriate positioning and tools to differentiate product(s) versus the competition in a profitable manner that adds value to the customer. Analyzes and synthesizes key competitive wins, competitive intelligence, and market research to lead the development of specific strategies to beat the competition. Develops go-to-market strategies & campaigns with detailed competitive playbooks aligned by portfolio.

· Product Definition: Ensure that appropriate Customer Requirements/Design Inputs are crafted to guide the development team. Utilize market research; customer input; zone input; and other means to ensure profitable and differentiated products are delivered to market. Assess Chemistry instrument and platform opportunities across a variety of segments and settings.

Your expertise:

  • 10+ years of progressive marketing and product management experience in varying specialties – marketing planning, building brand reputation, campaign development and execution, developing compelling sales messaging / materials and training, conducting market research, developing product portfolio strategy, and new product development and new launch initiatives.
  • Must have Core Lab Diagnostics experience.
  • Having responsibility for supporting the development of the strategic direction and global product plans based on customer, clinical, regulatory and reimbursement insights, as well as competitor analysis.
  • Strong results orientation and change agent. Must be fair, balanced, resilient, decisive and of high authenticity. Displays sense of urgency.
  • Bachelor degree in business; life sciences; engineering or related technical discipline. MBA is preferred
  • Travel up to 20%

Job Title: Senior Finance Controlling Professional - Malvern / Hybrid
Job Description:
Job Description

Job ID

416466

Company

Siemens Medical Solutions USA, Inc.

Organization

Siemens Healthineers

Job Family

Finance

Experience Level

Experienced Professional

Full Time / Part Time

Full-time

Remote vs Office

Hybrid (Remote/Office)

Contract Type

Permanent

The Senior Finance Controlling Specialist will play a key role as a crucial driving force within the dynamic NAM (North America) Performance Controlling team of Siemens Healthineers NAM zone. Reporting directly to the Director Finance - Performance Controlling, this position will be a subject matter expert, adept in every aspect of the group's functions, spanning finance partnership, performance controlling, KPI analysis, forecasting, and ad hoc projects. Moreover, this individual will actively seize opportunities to spearhead pivotal business initiatives, lead finance projects, and provide direct support to Executive Management, making their contribution indispensable to the organization's success.

Responsibilities

Specific responsibilities include the following:

  • As a trusted partner to Head of Customer Finance, provide expertise, advise, business administration and controlling services over the Field Sales organization and Customer Finance organization
  • Manage the financial close, cost center rolling forecast and budget planning processes for the Field Sales and Customer Finance organization.
  • Collaborate with Commission and GPO Administration groups, ensure accurate expense booking, reporting and forecasting of internal commissions & third-party sales fees
  • Develop cost allocation methodology and ensure transparency, analysis and effective communication to internal stakeholders on allocated cost, SG&A, COGS and headcount
  • Create new and improve existing financial models and forecast methodology
  • Suggest and implement meaningful KPIs to enable decision making
  • Support on corporate initiatives, evaluate and drive implementation of digitalization opportunities

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

  • Advanced know-how and experience in cost center budgeting/forecasting, monthly close activities, and various types of financial analysis (preferably 6-8 years of relevant experience)
  • Valued and recognized expert in above mentioned fields and internally trusted advisor to functional or line management
  • Excellent professional judgment and problem solving competence
  • Advanced communication skills to clearly present key issues and recommended actions
  • High proficiency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint / think-cell and SAP
  • Experience with business intelligence tools, data analysis and visualization, automation and digitalization are a plus (Excel macros, KNIME, UIPath, PowerBI, etc.)
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration or related area
  • Minimal travel (10%) may be required

At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

At Siemens Healthineers, We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as an Operations Finance Director (SCM Finance Director) for Ultrasound.

Our global team: We are a team of more than 68,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers .

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As an Operations Finance Director (SCM Finance Director) for Ultrasound, you will be responsible for:

  • Managing cost controls, budgeting and forecasting processes, financial analysis and reporting, and accounting procedures for Ultrasound SCM functions and factories worldwide.
  • Supporting strategic projects by providing financial analysis with regards to SCM functional management as well as product costs, including long term planning.
  • Supporting continuous opportunity creation to reduce product cost and to improve the overall COS cost structure across entire portfolio, as well as creating transparency of the entire cost base for HQ and factories.
  • Managing a diverse team of talented individuals, with focus on performance building and employee engagement.
  • Supporting the execution of SCM transformation measures and programs, including working capital optimization and inventory reduction.
  • Leading standard cost calculations and updates of the ERP system as well as physical inventory verification and the periodic cycle count process.
  • SCM departmental budgets, capital expense and headcount planning.
  • Supporting the monthly forecasts and planning process, including alignment with factories in APAC and EMEA.
  • Providing input to assist in investment decisions in operating capital with specific focus on material, finished and unfinished goods inventories.
  • Ensuring compliance with companies internal control requirements and financial reporting and accounting guidelines.
  • Supporting the implementation of the strategic plans for the business.
  • Liaising and building strong collaboration with all internal functions.
  • Hiring and retaining diverse, highly qualified staff and providing ongoing performance feedback.

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers:

  • Strong understanding of financial, operational and cost accounting.
  • Liaise and build strong collaboration with all internal functions and Senior Leadership.
  • Ability to simultaneously manage & prioritize multiple high priority projects.
  • Strong analytical and presentation skills.
  • You will be working with our latest technology and therefore you are willing to learn about new software and hardware solutions.
  • Proficiency with SAP, Hyperion, Jedox, ThinkCell and MS applications: Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
  • Serve as a role model for the Finance Community and beyond by living and promoting ownership culture and foster the professional development of individuals.

Required skills to have for the success of this role:

  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or related area(s); advanced degree preferred.
  • Minimum of 7-10 years in Finance roles, preferably with Operations Finance and/or Cost Accounting experience.
  • 5 years of experience in team management, preferably international teams.
  • Willingness to travel up to 20%.

The pay range for this position is $160,000 - $190,000 annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The annual incentive target is 20% of base pay. Siemens Healthineers offers a variety of health and wellness benefits including paid time off and holiday pay.   Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://benefitsatshs.com/index.html .

This information is provided per the required state Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Siemens Healthineers external or internal careers site.

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

At Siemens Healthineers, We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as a Director of Finance, Surgical Therapies Business Line .

The Director of Finance, Surgical Therapies Business Line is responsible for providing financial oversight, leadership, and support in all areas of business operation and financial controlling for the Siemens Healthineers North America (NAM) Surgical Therapies Business. This role reports to the VP Finance of NAM Advanced Therapies Business Area and is the Finance Partner to VP of NAM Surgical Therapies.

Our global team: We are a team of more than 68,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers .

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Financial Controller for Surgical Therapies Business Line, you will be responsible for:

  • Supporting Siemens Healthineers NAM Surgical Therapies business from a Finance perspective for Equipment and Service transactions.
  • Driving profitable growth through analysis and engagement with both operational and sales teams, support of compensation plan design and special incentives.
  • Ownership of local price book, perform deal reviews and price approvals.
  • Supporting Surgical Therapies management with financial analysis, identification of opportunities and mitigation of risks to achieve business targets.
  • Driving and implementing financial solutions for customers.
  • Managing the budget planning, forecast and closing processes and interact with many layers of the organization including international team members.
  • Surgical Therapies Business Line Profit & Loss responsibility plus reporting and KPI monitoring; ensure full integrity of books and records.
  • Driving process improvements and digitalization initiatives for efficiencies.

Required skills to have for the success of this role:

  • BS/BA Degree in Finance, Business Administration, or applicable degree. Advanced Degree Preferred.
  • 10 plus years of Finance/Business Administration experience and current knowledge of IFRS/GAAP, experience in managing Profit & Loss of a business is a plus.
  • Strong analytical skills and understanding of strategic business goals.
  • Demonstrated ability to form relationships and collaborate across global matrixed functions.
  • Excellent project and people management skills.
  • Goals and results orientated.
  • Customer-driven and focused.
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamically changing environment.
  • Ability to drive change management.
  • Problem solving and analytical skills.

Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company with over 170 years of experience and 18,000 patents. More than 48,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services. This is what truly matters to us.

At Siemens Healthineers, we are passionate about enabling healthcare professionals to deliver high quality patient care, and to do so affordably.  A leading global healthcare company, Siemens Healthineers continues to strengthen our portfolio of medical imaging and laboratory diagnostics, while adding new offerings such as managed services, consulting, and healthcare IT services – as well as further technologies in the growing market for therapeutic and molecular diagnostics.

Why you’ll love working for Siemens Healthineers:
  • Be part of exciting and innovative projects that help solve some of the world’s most significant health problems.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career.
  • Competitive total rewards package.
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education and technology, and sustainability, making a positive impact on communities.
  • Participate in our celebrations and social events.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Employee perks and discounts.
We are globally recognized as an Employer of Choice, but don’t just take our word for it. Here are some of our most recent awards and recognition:
  • Great Place to Work Certified 2021
  • Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality from the Human Rights Campaign
  • Best for Vets Employers by Military Times
  • Glassdoor Employer Rating: 4.0
Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as Senior Scientist, MR R&D Collaborations .

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Senior Scientist, MR R&D Collaborations , you will be responsible for:

  • Collaboration Management
    • Be the key point of contact on-site for both Siemens and customer. Coordinate appropriately with Siemens Leadership, Applications, Sales and Service teams
    • Communicate effectively between all stakeholders in the strategic partnership, escalating challenges appropriately
    • Proactively develop strong relationships with a variety of customers at Key Collaboration site
    • Identify areas of mutual interest for future collaboration projects that are relevant for the academic/industrial partnership, and strategic in nature
    • Develop and manage collaboration projects with your academic partners.
    • Adhere to Siemens’ collaborations policies and take ownership of the processes for collaboration management with your assigned partners.
    • Develop Academic Industry Partnership grants with your academic partner
    • Support transition of academic partner from competitor to Siemens MRI platform, identifying internal resources necessary
    • Drive, define and execute new clinical and research MR and cross modality collaboration projects
  • Research and Development
    • Work closely with your academic partners to drive MR research and translate this knowledge into MR products.
    • Drive the development of novel, clinically relevant techniques (MR pulse sequences and image reconstruction) with our research partners.
    • Develop and release prototypes of novel techniques in compliance with highest source code quality.
    • Evaluate prototypes and publish results in peer-reviewed journals.
    • Conduct original research resulting in patent applications.
    • Educate R&D and Applications colleagues on clinical research issues.
  • Product Development
    • Product integration of innovative techniques according to quality standards for medical devices.
    • Implementation of improvements to currently existing product features.
    • Maintenance and improvements of existing code base, bug fixing, testing.
    • Contribute to product protocol development for novel features.
  • Sales and Marketing Support
    • Provide content for articles, abstracts, and marketing materials for Siemens (such as MAGNETOM Flash)
    • Look for opportunities to translate clinical and technical knowledge into clinical and business value.
    • Support educational meetings, tradeshows, and site visits.
    • Answer questions from Sales and Marketing related to areas of the team’s responsibility.
    • Demonstrate strong knowledge of organization's business practices, issues faced, and take ownership in finding a resolution of those issues.
Required skills to have for the success of this role:
  • Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Biomedical Physics / Imaging Physics, or equivalent.
  • Exceptional communication skills – in all formats: writing, presentation, verbal.
  • Strong collaboration skills and ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast moving environment.
  • Strong background in MR physics and pulse sequence design.
  • Expertise in MR imaging techniques and clinical applications.
  • Experience in working with internal and external partners.
  • Substantial experience in C++/C software design, implementation and coding.
  • Experience using Matlab for signal and image processing.
  • Excellent teaching skills and a proactive can-do attitude.
  • Ability to work independently, prioritize, and take initiative
  • Ability to multi-task and follow through.
  • Detail-oriented and organized.
  • Skilled in MS office software applications (PowerPoint, Word, Excel).
  • Ability to travel up to 30%
  • Prior experience working on Siemens’ MR systems in pulse sequence design and image reconstruction
  • At least 2 years of relevant clinical and research MRI experience working on the Siemens MRI platform

Are you looking to expand your radiographic knowledge?

Siemens Healthineers offers a comprehensive training program for all our Application Specialists. You will learn everything you need to know about our systems, develop the soft skills necessary to teach high end clinical applications and further your post processing skills to an advanced level.

We are looking to expand our team of over 40 Application Specialists who have a range of experience in different modalities and clinical backgrounds. If you are experienced in your chosen field and wish to develop in your career as a Radiographer to become a modality-expert this may be the role for you.

Our Customer Services Clinical Applications team provide high quality best-in class training to our customers. Siemens Healthineers leads the way in diagnostic imaging solutions for the NHS and private sector, and this is an incredibly exciting opportunity in a continually interesting and challenging role. You’ll have the chance to work with leading Siemens technology in hospitals and universities across Great Britain and Ireland.

This role is home based with travel to our customer sites.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Application Specialist MR!

Your role:

  • provide applications support for the full range of Magnetic Resonance Imaging equipment to new and existing customers in the UK & Ireland
  • You provide regular telephone and remote support to customers and internal personnel
  • You keep up to date with the latest equipment on the market, clinical trends, and procedures
  • You undertake and become certified in the Siemens Application Specialist Education program
  • You support the sales team in the UK by carrying out applications training as well as pre and post sales demonstrations of Siemens Magnetic Resonance Imaging equipment
  • You support national and local exhibitions with workstation demonstrations and provide support during customer site visits
  • You develop and maintain relationships with Magnetic Resonance Imaging applications group at Head Office in Germany
  • You provide bespoke customer training courses

Your expertise:

  • Qualified Radiographers with recent clinical experience (ideally recent experience with Magnetic Resonance Imaging equipment)
  • Highly effective interpersonal and verbal communication skills.
  • Effective planning and organisational skills
  • Flexibility regarding regular travel throughout Great Britain & Ireland and spending significant time away from home during the working week

Benefits

  • A competitive salary
  • Generous pension contributions
  • 26 days holiday (pro rata)
  • Access to our flexible benefits from private medical insurance to dental cover
  • Corporate Social Responsibility opportunities including 2 paid volunteering days per year
  • Support from our 24/7 employee assistance programme

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-uk/molecular-imaging

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-uk/careers

•            Service Area – Atlanta, GA

•            Shift Requirements after onboarding/training for this role: M-F, 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Customer Service Engineer II, you will be responsible for :

  • You will be servicing CT/MR Imaging Equipment in the Atlanta, GA area. Customer Service Engineer Level based on prior experience.
  • You will be responsible for installing, troubleshooting, repairing and performing preventative maintenance on all Siemens Healthcare systems at customer sites with minimal supervision.
  • You will be responsible for delivering both timely and effective repairs as well as adequate training of operators to ensure optimal system performance, resulting in superior customer satisfaction.
  • You will manage financial performance within their territory, meeting or exceeding budget for revenue generation, expense control and inventory management.
  • You will manage company assets to include a company car, cell phone, computer, tools, inventory parts, etc.
  • Establish and maintain proper business relationships with customers and peers, as well as performing necessary administrative duties accurately.

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers

  • You have knowledge and experience performing service, preventative maintenance and modifications on Medical Imaging Equipment at customer sites with minimal supervision.
  • You have the ability and experience to establish and maintain proper business relationships with customers and peers, as well as performing necessary administrative duties accurately.
  • You have experience in testing, repairing and maintaining capital medical equipment.
  • You have strong customer service and communication skills.
  • You are proficient in the use of tools and service test equipment.

· General understanding of the principles of electricity, power supplies, and grounding.

Required skills to have for the success of this role

· Minimum high school diploma; technical Associates Degree or equivalent preferred.

· Must be proficient in the use of tools and service test equipment, with the ability to work both individually and in an established team setting.

· Proficiency in all necessary network applications and tools (including but not limited to eVO, mButler, MS Office applications, Concur, NAM Customer Service website—Engineer Tools).

· 3+ years' experience as a medical technologist or field service engineer (biomedical engineer) servicing diagnostic instruments needed.

  • Valid driver's license, ability to drive independently day and night, and good driving record required.
  • Physical Requirements: Lifting 50lbs (floor to above waist/head), walking, ladder/stepstool climbing, bending, twisting, sitting work, squatting work, standing work, high-reach, fine grasping manipulation, good vision, and ability to work alone.

Must demonstrate excellent judgment in customer relations and in managing company resources; strong competency in instrument systems technology to include mechanics, electrical, chemistry, and software technology; experience with electronics, hydraulic and pneumatic systems.

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team as Customer Service Engineer II to Pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

Our global team : We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture : We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers .

Location: Des Moines, Iowa

Shift: Monday through Friday 8a to 5p

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Customer Service Engineer II , you will be responsible for :

  • You will be responsible for installing, troubleshooting, repairing and performing preventative maintenance on all Siemens Healthcare Diagnostics instrumentation (primarily Dimension and Vista Chemistry products) at customer sites with minimal supervision.
  • You will be responsible for delivering both timely and effective repairs as well as adequate training of operators to ensure optimal system performance, resulting in superior customer satisfaction.
  • You will manage financial performance within their territory, meeting or exceeding budget for revenue generation, expense control and inventory management.
  • You will manage company assets to include a company car, cell phone, computer, tools, inventory parts, etc.
  • Establish and maintain proper business relationships with customers and peers, as well as performing necessary administrative duties accurately.

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers

  • You have the ability and experience to establish and maintain proper business relationships with customers and peers, as well as performing necessary administrative duties accurately.

· You have experience in testing, repairing and maintaining capital medical equipment

· You have strong customer service and communication skills

· You are proficient in the use of tools and service test equipment

· You have experience in testing, repairing and maintaining capital medical equipment

Required skills to have for the success of this role

· Minimum high school diploma; technical Associates Degree or equivalent preferred.

· Must be proficient in the use of tools and service test equipment, with the ability to work both individually and in an established team setting.

· 5+ years experience as a medical technologist or field service engineer (biomedical engineer) servicing diagnostic instruments needed.

Must demonstrate excellent judgment in customer relations and in managing company resources; strong competency in instrument systems technology to include mechanics, electrical, chemistry, and software technology; experience with electronics, hydraulic and pneumatic systems.

• Service Area – South Carolina

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Regional Service Manager, you will be responsible for:

· Responsible for managing the healthcare Field Service business by directing, coordinating, and leading the organization and its activities to meet customer service expectations and financial metrics. The Regional Service Manager (RSM) reports to the Service Vice President of Siemens Healthineers.

Responsibilities

  • Work to maximize customer loyalty and satisfaction
  • Communicate the value proposition of Siemens service to customers
  • Obtaining service financial goals through revenue attainment and effective cost containment.
  • Ensure compliance with FDA Good Manufacturing Practices
  • Meet annual RSM goals and metrics as established
  • Hire, develop, train and coach Customer Service Engineers (CSE’s)
  • Prioritize customer and business objectives to provide clear direction to CSE’s
  • Ensure customer satisfaction through timely follow up on all issues
  • Key Customer and area Management
    • Develop long term value-based relationships with key accounts
    • Provide additional escalation support to resolve key account issues
    • Develop proactive account plans to prevent or predict issues
    • Provide continues communication across organization for key accounts

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

  • BS/BA in related discipline, or advanced degree, where required, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 8+ years of successful experience in a directly related field and successful demonstration of Key Responsibilities and Knowledge as presented above.
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Superior communication skills (written and oral) and ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders at many levels within the organization
  • Effectively present information to co-workers and employee groups, including upper management, customers at various levels and public representatives
  • Ability to read, analyze and translate into action financial profit and loss statements.
  • Professional level knowledge on using analytical databases and complex excel workbooks and associated pivot tables.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents
  • Ability to thrive as a member of a collaborative, cross-functional team
  • Competent knowledge of MS Office applications
  • Must have a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record over the last three years.

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience

• Experience in managing large remote employee-based territory

• Knowledge of the Diagnostic Imaging Instruments or equivalent Diagnostic Imaging industry experience

• Ability to articulate and explain value of Service Agreement offerings

• Working knowledge of SAP or experience with equivalent enterprise service software solution

• Service Area –Destin, FL/ Pensacola, FL/ Mobile, AL Area

• Shift Requirements after onboarding/training for this role: Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Customer Service Engineer 1, you will be responsible for :

  • You will be servicing Imaging Equipment in the Destin, FL/ Pensacola, FL/ Mobile, AL Area. Customer Service Engineer Level can be adjusted based on prior experience.
  • You are in a field-based, customer-facing role that primarily installs, services, maintains and modifies Siemens’ imaging equipment at customer sites.
  • You are the "Face of Siemens" to the customer.
  • You support the MR & CT Modality initially, with potential to cross train into other modalities in the future.
  • You are flexible and willing to work different shifts and On-Call rotations as business needs dictate, including willingness to work overtime as required. Advanced notice will be provided for any shift changes.
  • You report to the Regional Service Manager at Siemens Medical Solutions.

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to do develop your career with Healthineers

  • You have knowledge and experience performing service, preventative maintenance, and modifications on Medical Imaging Equipment at customer sites with minimal supervision.
  • You have previous experience with the desired Medical Imaging Equipment: MR & CT Modality
  • You have the ability and experience to establish and maintain proper business relationships with customers and peers, as well as performing necessary administrative duties timely and accurately.
  • You have a strong background working with electronics and are proficient in the use of service tools and service test equipment
  • You have proficient PC skills (MS Windows & Microsoft Office 365 -Outlook, Excel, SharePoint, etc.)

Required skills to have for the success of this role

  • Minimum Technical Degree or equivalent experience
  • Strong electronics background and computer skills required
  • 5-8 Years of field service experience is desired
  • Ability to work both individually and in an established team setting
  • You have strong customer service and communication skills
  • Ability to travel and provide service in assigned geography; willingness to participate in an on-call rotation after training and certification
  • Valid driver's license, ability to drive independently day and night, and good driving record required
  • Physical Requirements: Lifting 50lbs (floor to above waist/head), walking, ladder/stepstool climbing, bending, twisting, sitting work, squatting work, standing work, high-reach, fine grasping manipulation, good vision, and ability to work alone.
